Trial_Design.evidence: A total of 116 patients scheduled for elective laparoscopic hepatectomy were randomly assigned to two groups

Participants.evidence: 116 patients scheduled for elective laparoscopic hepatectomy

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to two groups: the goal-directed fluid therapy (GDFT) crystalloid group and the GDFT colloid group

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to investigate the impact of two-stage goal-directed crystalloid versus colloid fluid therapy on postoperative quality of recovery

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcome was the 24 h postoperative Quality of Recovery-15 (QoR-15) score

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 116 patients scheduled for elective laparoscopic hepatectomy were randomly assigned to two groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no significant difference in the total QoR-15 scores between the two groups at each point in time ( P > 0.05)
